details.content: The Sabarimala temple had opened Friday evening for the two-month-long Mandala Pooja-Magaravilaku annual pilgrimage season, as a stand-off continued over the entry of menstrual age women into the shrine.

details.title: Over 60 arrested for protests
details.content: Over 60 people were arrested late Sunday night after fresh protests broke out by devotees against the Kerala Police's restrictions.

details.title: Right wing group leader KP Sasikala en route Sabarimala again
details.content: On Saturday after she was detained for attempting to visit the shrine, a dawn-to-dusk hartal was called by Hindu Aikya Vedi.

TV reports say she is with a baby and that she has come to the shrine for her grandson's choroonu (feedng ceremony).

#SabarimalaTemple Hindu Aikya Vedi leader K P Sasikala who reached Nilakkal today to visit Sabarimala given notice by police directing her to comply with six hours time allotted for her stay at Sannidhanam @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/ysBOw3C2Sx

— ajay kanth (@ajaykanth7) November 19, 2018
Union minister Alphons Kannanthanam reaches Nilakkal

#SabarimalaTemple Union Minister Alphons Kannanthanam interacting with reporters at Nilakkal today morning. He flays Kerala government for imposing Section144 in Sabarimala @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/PVzTUXfjTA

— ajay kanth (@ajaykanth7) November 19, 2018
Union minister Alphons Kannamthanam pushing his car at Nilakkal. (Photo | A Sanesh/ EPS)

details.title: Minister questions Sec 144 imposition
details.content:
A situation worse than emergency is happening here, the devotees are not allowed to go up. Section 144 is imposed for no reason. Devotees are not terrorists, why do they need 15000 policemen here? : KJ Alphons MoS Tourism on #SabarimalaTemple issue pic.twitter.com/sOHaC3dAXP

— ANI (@ANI) November 19, 2018

details.title: WATCH VIDEO
40 BJP Yuva Morcha workers arrested in Thodupuzha
details.content: BJP Yuva Morcha workers begin protest; hurl stones at police station and vandalise KSRTC buses, reports Manorama News

details.title: Pinarayi Vijayan addresses KUWJ meeting
details.content: Chief Minister Vijayan has begun his address to the Kerala Union of Working Journalists in Kozhikode.

details.title: Health dept has fears about open defecation issue
details.content:
As the Mandala-Makaravilakku pilgrimage season of the #SabarimalaTemple progresses, the #Health Department fears that the issue of #opendefecation is likely to become a public health concern @MoHFW_INDIA @swachhbharat @CMOKerala @NewIndianXpress

— Dileep V Kumar (@dileepvk_TNIE) November 19, 2018

details.title: Report to be submitted on pilgrim's complaints about police restrictions
details.content:
To address the plaints of pilgrims at #SabarimalaTemple #Kerala #HumanRights Commission asks #Devaswom Commissioner, State Police Chief and LSGD Secretary to inquire into the matter and submit a report within two weeks #Kerala @NewIndianXpress

— Dileep V Kumar (@dileepvk_TNIE) November 19, 2018
Manorama reports that namajapa (chanting) protests have begun outside the hall where the Chief Minister is speaking in Kozhikode.

details.title: Ramesh Chennithala slams Kerala CM for police action against devotees
details.content: "It is police high-handedness. Innocent devotees who sought shelter at Valiya Nadappandhal (covered pathway) were also arrested. They all are not Sangh Parivar activists who reached there to create trouble. Is Kerala under the rule of Hitler (Nazi ruler Adolf Hitler)," Chennithala told reporters

details.title: HC condemns Kerala Police for action against devotees
details.content:
Justice P R Ramachandran comes down heavily on state police for excess action at Sabarimala. Orally observes that genuine devotees are being harassed. Asks for the presence of Advocate General at 1.45 PM to offer explanation #Sabarimala

— Live Law (@LiveLawIndia) November 19, 2018

Hindu Aikya Vedi leader K P Sasikala who reached Nilakkal today to visit Sabarimala showing the notice issued by police directing her to comply with six hours time allotted for her stay at Sannidhanam. (Photo | A Sanesh/ EPS)

details.title: Three women seek support to visit Sabarimala
details.content: Three young women hold press meet at Kochi press club, seek support of  government, police to visit Sabarimala.

details.title: Kerala CM defends police action in Sabarimala
details.content: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan defending the police action said the troublemakers were RSS workers and not Ayyappa devotees. (Read more)

details.title: Travancore Devaswom Board moves SC seeking more time to implement verdict
details.content: Travancore Devaswom Board moves SC seeking more time to implement its verdict allowing women of all age groups to enter Sabarimala temple.

details.title: SC rejects plea seeking urgent hearing of review petition
details.content: Plea seeking urgent hearing of writ and review petitions of September 28 verdict has been rejected by the SC.
